Although a will was propounded, yet if a descendant of the testator was therein pretermitted (praeteritus), i. e. not expressly either instituted successor or disinherited, possession was not granted to the devisees but to the pretermitted descendant (bono- rum possessio contra tabulas). Contra-tabulas possession was sometimes equivalent to intestacy, sometimes to partial testacy.
